titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1405: Ledger of Risaliti accounts

notesStmt.note: Forms part of: Gondi-Medici Business Records.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Ledger of accounts of Francesco di Stefano Risaliti for the years 1550-1558. Francesco di Stefano Risaliti appears to be a member of the guild of the lanaioli, merchants who dealt in woolen cloth and cooperated with the other corporations of bankers and merchants in the comune of Florence. The Risaliti, like other lanaioli, saw all the processes from the raw baled wool through the final cloth, woven at numerous looms scattered in domiciles throughout the city. The ledger reflects various activities and mentions transactions with many different workers (including weavers, spinners, dyers) who were paid for their services. When recording these transactions, information about the various phases of wool manufacturing is also present, often described in great detail. Records of transactions with artisans whose businesses were not related to wool manufacturing, such as leather and wax workers, are also present, but less frequent.

supportDesc.extent: 160 leaves : 333 x 229 mm. bound to 340 x 234 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (parchment) + 160 leaves; versos numbered 1-113, 113-114, [115-160], contemporary pagination in ink, modern pagination in pencil, upper left verso; rectos numbered [i], i-cxiii, cxiii, cxiiii, 115-151, [152-158] upper right recto (leaves 152-158 are blank but ruled).

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns with vertical bounding lines in lead; the large column on the left with the name of the counterpart and a brief description of the transaction, and the smaller one on the right with the amount of the transaction.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script, perhaps by multiple hands.

binding.p: Contemporary vellum, no. 250 on spine; the heading Quaderno di manifattori, no. 67, signet D and letter A with decorative penwork on upper cover; lower cover wraps around upper cover with leather straps; decorative leatherwork on spine.
